definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: Some of them are protective colouring that is designed to make it easier to survive in a crowded, judgemental and often intolerant world.
sentences.chinese: 有些是为了更好地在嘈杂残酷的世界中生存的保护色。

sentences.english: Acamouflaged shape moving through the sun-dappled shadows.
sentences.chinese: 一个保护色的身形在阳光斑驳的阴影中移动。

sentences.english: For chameleons this is a defense strategy, is it the same for us?
sentences.chinese: 对于变色龙来说，这叫做保护色，对我们也是这样吗？

sentences.english: Some insects have a natural camouflage which hide them from the attack of their enemy.
sentences.chinese: 有些昆虫有一种天然的保护色可以防止敌人的袭击。

sentences.english: The protective color of some plants and animals changes with their surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 一些动植物的保护色会随环境的变化而变化。

sentences.english: For others, it is a form of camouflage .
sentences.chinese: 对另一些生物而言，光亮则相当于保护色。

sentences.english: Their white fur serves as protective coloring in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 它们白色的皮毛，在雪中起保护色的作用。

sentences.english: Some insects often escape observation because of protective coloring.
sentences.chinese: 有些昆虫因有保护色而往往不被察觉。

definition: character acquired through long habit/habits and properties
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
